text: HIV-1 <extra_id_0> Nef <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein inhibits the recruitment of AP-1 DNA - binding activity in human T-cells .
The human immunodeficiency virus type 1 long terminal repeat , HIV-1-LTR , contains binding sites for several cellular transcription factors which contribute to HIV-1 gene expression .

Our previous studies on the function of the HIV-1-encoded <extra_id_0> Nef <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein suggested that <extra_id_0> Nef <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> may be an inhibitor HIV-1 transcription .

To determine whether <extra_id_0> Nef <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> affects the binding of cellular factors implicated in HIV-1 regulation , 32P-labeled oligonucleotides corresponding to the binding sites were incubated with nuclear extracts prepared from <extra_id_0> Nef <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - expressing T-cell lines that were not stimulated or were stimulated with T-cell mitogens .
We found that <extra_id_0> Nef <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> inhibited the recruitment of AP-1 DNA - binding activity in mitogen - stimulated human T-cells .

Additionally , <extra_id_0> Nef <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expressing cells were transiently transfected with a plasmid in which HIV-1 AP-1 DNA recognition sequences were cloned downstream of the <extra_id_0> chloramphenicol acetyltransferase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> CAT <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) gene .

Mitogen - mediated transcriptional activation of the <extra_id_0> CAT <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene in this construct was inhibited in <extra_id_0> Nef <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - expressing cells but not in control cells .

text: These studies suggest that , by inhibiting AP-1 activation , <extra_id_0> Nef <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> may play a role in regulating HIV-1 gene expression in infected T-cells .
